page.title: 09BONFIRE NIGHT
page.content: Most children enjoy Bonfire Night. IT is held every year to commemorate the time when{Guy Fawkes}nearly blew up the Houses of Parliament. These celebrations are held all over the country and people build bonfires and set off fireworks. In Oldham we have a song called the{cobcoaling}song which we sing. We go round to houses and sing our sopng in the same way that carol singers do and people give us money. The song goes like thos :"{WE {COME A COB COALING FOR BONFIRE TIME. {YOUR COAL AND YOUR MONEY WE HOPE YOU {ENJOY.}"It finishes with :"{IF YOU {GIVE US NOWT WE'LL STEAL NOWT AND BID {YOU GOOD NIGHT .}"At our bonfire parties we eat special food. We have potato pie,black peas,sticky gingerbread called parkin and treacle toffe. We make a dummy Guy to burn on the fire.
